prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Trucy Wright
Description: A particular set of circumstances led to her being adopted by Mr. Wright. A world-class magician on the rise.
Character 1
Name: Athena Cykes
Description: The youngest lawyer in our agency. She apparently studied psychology in Europe.
Character 2
Name: Phoenix Wright
Description: My boss. He taught me a lot about what it means to be a lawyer.
Character 3
Name: Nahyuta Sahdmadhi
Description: A prosecutor from Khura'in. He's also a monk, which explains why he's known as the "Last Rites Prosecutor."
Character 4
Name: Dhurke Sahdmadhi
Description: Leader of the Defiant Dragons, and the man who raised me. He was a lawyer once.
Character 5
Name: Archie Buff
Description: An archeologist in Kurain Village. He was asked by someone to study the Founder's Orb.
Character 6
Name: Datz Are'bal
Description: A member of the Defiant Dragons, and Dhurke's right-hand man. He's always been one to laugh at just about anything.
Character 7
Name: Ema Skye
Description: A detective. It looks like she finally became the forensics investigator she always wanted to be.
Character 8
Name: Paul Atishon
Description: He's looking to represent Kurain Village. His remarkable self-confidence is blinding.
Character 9
Name: Sergeant Buff → Armie Buff
Description: The doctor's reclusive child. He lost his mother in a fire.
Character 10
Name: Pearl Fey
Description: Ms. Maya Fey's cousin. She's also one of Kurain Village's spirit mediums. She's always really courteous.
Character 11
Name: Miles Edgeworth
Description: Mr. Wright's best friend and the district's chief prosecutor. His frilly cravat makes a strong fashion statement.
Character 12
Name: Maya Fey
Description: Mr. Wright's former assistant. She's currently training in Khura'in. I'm told she can channel the dead.
Character 13
Name: Inga Karkhuul Khura'in
Description: Khura'in's Minister of Justice and the kingdom's second-in-command.
Character 14
Name: Rayfa Padma Khura'in
Description: Daughter of Ga'ran and princess of Khura'in who is more than a little spoiled.
Character 15
Name: Ga'ran Sigatar Khura'in
Description: The grand priestess and queen of Khura'in. It's said that she can channel the dead.
Character 16
Name: Nayna
Description: Rayfa's attendant. She disappeared all of a sudden after Minister Inga's death.
Character 17
Name: Ahlbi Ur'gaid
Description: When not undergoing monastic training, this plucky kid works as a tour guide.
Character 18
Name: Amara Sigatar Khura'in
Description: The previous queen. She is a spirit medium known as the grand priestess and possesses incredible spiritual power.
Character 19
Name: Trucy Wright
Description: An aspiring magician and my daughter. I adopted her nine years ago.
Character 20
Name: Athena Cykes
Description: The newest lawyer in my office with a background in psychology.
Character 21
Name: Apollo Justice
Description: A reliable subordinate at my office. Serious and hot-blooded with vocal chords made of steel.
Character 22
Name: Nahyuta Sahdmadhi
Description: A Khura'inese prosecutor and monk. He's also known as the "Last Rites Prosecutor."
Character 23
Name: Dhurke Sahdmadhi
Description: Leader of the Defiant Dragons and Apollo's adoptive father.
Character 24
Name: Datz Are'bal
Description: The Defiant Dragons' XO and Dhurke's right-hand man. He will laugh at just about anything.
Character 25
Name: Ema Skye
Description: A detective with a love of science. She's finally achieved her dream of becoming a forensics investigator.
Character 26
Name: Miles Edgeworth
Description: The district's chief prosecutor and my childhood friend. We used to go head-to-head back in his courtroom days.
Character 27
Name: Maya Fey
Description: A practitioner of the Kurain Channeling Technique. We used to take on all sorts of cases together.
Character 28
Name: Inga Karkhuul Khura'in
Description: Khura'in's Minister of Justice. He was killed during the hostage exchange.
Character 29
Name: Rayfa Padma Khura'in
Description: A Khura'inist priestess and crown princess of Khura'in. Her Divination Séances show the last memories of the dead.
Character 30
Name: Ga'ran Sigatar Khura'in
Description: The grand priestess and queen of Khura'in. It's said that she can channel the dead.
Character 31
Name: Nayna
Description: Rayfa's attendant. She disappeared all of a sudden after Minister Inga's death.
Character 32
Name: Ahlbi Ur'gaid
Description: When not undergoing monastic training, this plucky kid works as a tour guide.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: My beloved attorney's badge. Wearing it gets me raring to go.
Evidence 1
Name: Founder's Orb
Description: A national treasure of the Kingdom of Khura'in. None but those of in the royal family have laid eyes on it. Heating the Founder's Orb revealed the statue within. The founder's form has appeared from within. It seems only the queen knows the founder's real name.
Evidence 2
Name: Photo of My Father
Description: A picture of my biological father, Jove Justice, who died in Khura'in.
Evidence 3
Name: Study Photo
Description: Atishon saw Datz fleeing the scene the night of the murder. One of the books is stained with coffee.
Evidence 4
Name: Study Diagram
Description: A diagram of the doctors's study. Note the bookcase, large window, and second-floor area.
Evidence 5
Name: Research Notes
Description: Research notes on the Song of Ceremony and the box containing the Founder's Orb.
Evidence 6
Name: Orb Transfer Agreement
Description: States: "I agree to hand over the Founder's Orb to the Defiant Dragons if I will come to no harm."
Evidence 7
Name: Sarge's Drone
Description: A helicopter drone operated by the doctor's kid. Equipped with a camera and a microphone.
Evidence 8
Name: Glowing Moss
Description: Stuck to the insole of the doctor's boot. It probably got there when he went to hide the Founder's Orb.
Evidence 9
Name: E-Mail
Description: Data obtained from the doctor's computer. Includes a report on his research into the Founder's Orb.
Evidence 10
Name: Doctor's Reading Glasses
Description: The doctor's poor eyesight meant he couldn't read anything without these. They were found on his desk.
Evidence 11
Name: Raincoat
Description: Seems the doctor wore this last night. Bears a distinctive yellow and green two-tone design.
Evidence 12
Name: Robbery Report
Description: A report filed a year ago by one Mr. Paul Atishon-Wimperson for the theft of the Crystal of Ami Fey.
Evidence 13
Name: Dr. Buff's Autopsy Report
Description: Dr. Buff was struck with the corner of some object. The time of death is between 10 and 11 PM.
Evidence 14
Name: Armie's Statement
Description: She'd fled to her room when she realized someone had moved her while she'd been unconscious on the second floor.
Evidence 15
Name: Inga's Autopsy Report
Description: Stabbed from behind. Cause of death is blood loss. Time of death is approximately 3 PM.
Evidence 16
Name: Tomb Diagram
Description: A diagram of the crime scene. Amara's sarcophagus is in the very center of the room.
Evidence 17
Name: Tomb Crime Photo
Description: A photo of Inga's body. He was stabbed in the back with a knife.
Evidence 18
Name: Gemstone
Description: Inga's button, discovered in the ashes of the tomb's incense burners. Caked in soot.
Evidence 19
Name: Pink Butterfly Pendant
Description: A pendant adorned with a pink butterfly. Seems it belongs to Dhurke. Stained with the victim's blood. A locket found at the crime scene. It actually belongs to Amara.
Evidence 20
Name: Mysterious Bloodstain
Description: A bloodstain from Amara's Tomb. This bloodstain found had been wiped up by someone. Analysis reveals that it's Dhurke's blood.
Evidence 21
Name: Painkiller Shots
Description: The medication Inga used for his back pain. Said to make the pain disappear.
Evidence 22
Name: Inga's Notepad
Description: A notepad used by Inga. People's characteristics are written inside.
Evidence 23
Name: Woman's Photo
Description: A photo showing Dhurke and Amara's life on the run about 23 years ago. [caption] Amara is holding a baby, sitting on a chair. Behind her are some books. One of the books has the logo of the Defiant Dragons on its cover.
Evidence 24
Name: Channeling Photo
Description: A picture taken at around 2 PM of the channeling rite.
Evidence 25
Name: Ahlbi's Statement
Description: At around 2 PM, Shah'do was surprised by a firecracker, ran into the courtyard, spooked Nayna and stole her hat.
Evidence 26
Name: Amara's Assassination File
Description: A file containing a ton of info on the assassination of Amara Sigatar Khura'in.
Evidence 27
Name: Dhurke's Law Book
Description: A document establishing the Defense Culpability Act in the name of the queen.
Evidence 28
Name: Dhurke's Badge
Description: The symbol of Dhurke's creed: "A dragon never yields." Nahyuta never confiscated it.
Evidence 29
Name: Dhurke's Corpse Photo
Description: More than three days have passed since his death death. He was shot three times in the chest.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: I was struck by a sudden dizziness the moment I entered the tomb.
Person: Dhurke
Testimony 1
Testimony: The next thing I knew, I was standing there with a bloody knife in my hand.
Person: Dhurke
Testimony 2
Testimony: The possibility of a third party being there in the tomb is probably nonexistent.
Person: Dhurke
Testimony 3
Testimony: And lying right in front of me was Inga, dead as a doornail.
Person: Dhurke
Testimony 4
Testimony: I've no recollection of what happened in the interim.
Person: Dhurke
Testimony 5
Testimony: I don't have a motive for killing Inga. After all, me and my ilk seek a bloodless revolution.
Person: Dhurke
Testimony 6
Testimony: But I didn't kill him. At least, I don't think I did. It'd go against everything I believe in.
Person: Dhurke
Testimony 7
Testimony: Though, I guess there's no evidence that proves I didn't kill him either...
Person: Dhurke

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else. Let's think step by step:
response:
To solve this problem, we'll analyze both the evidences and testimonies to find contradictions. A contradiction would occur if a testimony is directly negated or disproven by a piece of evidence.

Let's consider the testimonies from Dhurke. We are looking for a contradiction between one of Dhurke's testimonies and a piece of evidence:

1. **Testimony 0:** Dhurke mentions feeling dizziness upon entering a tomb.
2. **Testimony 1:** Dhurke finds himself with a bloody knife in hand without recollection of acquiring it.
3. **Testimony 2:** Dhurke doubts the possibility of a third party in the tomb.
4. **Testimony 3:** Dhurke testifies that Inga was dead in front of him.
5. **Testimony 4:** Dhurke has no memory of the events between his entering the tomb and Inga's death.
6. **Testimony 5:** Dhurke claims he has no motive to kill Inga.
7. **Testimony 6:** Dhurke believes he didn't kill Inga, as it goes against his beliefs.
8. **Testimony 7:** Dhurke admits lacking evidence to prove he didn’t kill Inga.

Next, review the evidences:

- **Evidence 19: Pink Butterfly Pendant** is key. It is stated to belong to Dhurke and is stained with the victim's blood. However, this pendant actually belongs to Amara (as indicated by being a locket found at the crime scene).

This means that while Dhurke believes based on his testimony that he was holding a bloody knife and standing over Inga's body, the presence of evidence that includes a pendant (not a knife) with blood suggests alternative narratives—possibly implying another person involved, conflicting with Dhurke's Testimony 2 about the improbability of a third party.

This clash between Dhurke's testimonies about likely being responsible (or at least without memories to contradict it) and the suggestion of potentially someone else's involvement hinted by the evidence directly creates a contradiction supporting an alternate possibility.

Therefore, the contradiction lies between:

- **Evidence 19: Pink Butterfly Pendant**, which implies the presence or implication of another party (Amara), clashing with
- **Testimony 2:** Where Dhurke dismisses the probability of a third party's presence in the tomb.

Thus, the contradictory pair is captured in JSON format as:

{"evidence": 19, "testimony": 2}

Description: More than three days have passed since his death death. He was shot three times in the chest.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: On the day of the murder, I was gazing upon the courtyard from my second-floor veranda.
Person: Rayfa
Testimony 1
Testimony: Around 2:30 PM, I saw my father heading for Amara's Tomb.
Person: Rayfa
Testimony 2
Testimony: My father let out a scream and came dashing out of his room -- his face, pale.
Person: Rayfa
Testimony 3
Testimony: I had been gazing upon the courtyard since about 2, but father was the only one I saw.
Person: Rafya
Testimony 4
Testimony: Then, at about 2:45, I saw Barbed Head and company enter the courtyard.
Person: Rayfa
Testimony 5
Testimony: I saw no one go in or out of the tomb after my father entered at about 2:30.
Person: Rayfa

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else. Let's think step by step:
response:
To find contradictions between evidence and testimony, we must identify inconsistencies between times and events described by different sources.

Let's examine the testimonies of Rayfa:

1. She claims to have been gazing upon the courtyard from her veranda on the day of the murder. (Testimony 0)
2. She says that around 2:30 PM, she saw her father heading towards Amara's Tomb. (Testimony 1)
3. She mentions her father let out a scream and came dashing out of his room with a pale face. (Testimony 2)
4. Rayfa states she had been gazing upon the courtyard since about 2, but her father was the only one she saw. (Testimony 3)
5. At around 2:45, she saw "Barbed Head and company" enter the courtyard. (Testimony 4)
6. She saw no one enter or leave the tomb after her father entered around 2:30 PM. (Testimony 5)

Now, let's match these testimonies against the evidence:

- Evidence about the Founder's Orb and the Orb Transfer Agreement is not directly related to movements in the courtyard or tomb.
- Review from Inga's Autopsy Report shows he was stabbed from behind, with the cause of death being blood loss and the time of death approximately at 3 PM.
- The Channeling Photo taken around 2 PM might give additional context to what Rayfa could have seen.
  
Focusing on Testimony 3, Rayfa claims to have seen only her father when watching from around 2 PM. However, Evidence 24 (Channeling Photo) was taken around 2 PM, when people would have been present apart from her father. The issue here is that Rayfa saw no one else except her father, while there is evidence suggesting others would have been involved in or near the courtyard at that time.

Thus, the contradiction lies in Rayfa seeing only her father while the Channeling Photo indicates other individuals were present.  
{"evidence": 24, "testimony": 3}

Description: Atishon saw Datz fleeing the scene the night of the murder. One of the books is stained with coffee.
Evidence 4
Name: Study Diagram
Description: A diagram of the doctors's study. Note the bookcase, large window, and second-floor area.
Evidence 5
Name: Research Notes
Description: Research notes on the Song of Ceremony and the box containing the Founder's Orb.
Evidence 6
Name: Orb Transfer Agreement
Description: States: "I agree to hand over the Founder's Orb to the Defiant Dragons if I will come to no harm."
Evidence 7
Name: Sarge's Drone
Description: A helicopter drone operated by the doctor's kid. Equipped with a camera and a microphone.
Evidence 8
Name: Glowing Moss
Description: Stuck to the insole of the doctor's boot. It probably got there when he went to hide the Founder's Orb.
Evidence 9
Name: E-Mail
Description: Data obtained from the doctor's computer. Includes a report on his research into the Founder's Orb.
Evidence 10
Name: Doctor's Reading Glasses
Description: The doctor's poor eyesight meant he couldn't read anything without these. They were found on his desk.
Evidence 11
Name: Raincoat
Description: Seems the doctor wore this last night. Bears a distinctive yellow and green two-tone design.
Evidence 12
Name: Robbery Report
Description: A report filed a year ago by one Mr. Paul Atishon-Wimperson for the theft of the Crystal of Ami Fey.
Evidence 13
Name: Dr. Buff's Autopsy Report
Description: Dr. Buff was struck with the corner of some object. The time of death is between 10 and 11 PM.
Evidence 14
Name: Armie's Statement
Description: She'd fled to her room when she realized someone had moved her while she'd been unconscious on the second floor.
Evidence 15
Name: Inga's Autopsy Report
Description: Stabbed from behind. Cause of death is blood loss. Time of death is approximately 3 PM.
Evidence 16
Name: Tomb Diagram
Description: A diagram of the crime scene. Amara's sarcophagus is in the very center of the room.
Evidence 17
Name: Tomb Crime Photo
Description: A photo of Inga's body. He was stabbed in the back with a knife.
Evidence 18
Name: Gemstone
Description: Inga's button, discovered in the ashes of the tomb's incense burners. Caked in soot.
Evidence 19
Name: Pink Butterfly Pendant
Description: A pendant adorned with a pink butterfly. Seems it belongs to Dhurke. Stained with the victim's blood. A locket found at the crime scene. It actually belongs to Amara.
Evidence 20
Name: Mysterious Bloodstain
Description: A bloodstain from Amara's Tomb. This bloodstain found had been wiped up by someone. Analysis reveals that it's Dhurke's blood.
Evidence 21
Name: Painkiller Shots
Description: The medication Inga used for his back pain. Said to make the pain disappear.
Evidence 22
Name: Inga's Notepad
Description: A notepad used by Inga. People's characteristics are written inside.
Evidence 23
Name: Woman's Photo
Description: A photo showing Dhurke and Amara's life on the run about 23 years ago. [caption] Amara is holding a baby, sitting on a chair. Behind her are some books. One of the books has the logo of the Defiant Dragons on its cover.
["The Defiant Dragons was formed after Amara's assassination."]
Evidence 24
Name: Channeling Photo
Description: A picture taken at around 2 PM of the channeling rite.
Evidence 25
Name: Ahlbi's Statement
Description: At around 2 PM, Shah'do was surprised by a firecracker, ran into the courtyard, spooked Nayna and stole her hat.
Evidence 26
Name: Amara's Assassination File
Description: A file containing a ton of info on the assassination of Amara Sigatar Khura'in.
Evidence 27
Name: Dhurke's Law Book
Description: A document establishing the Defense Culpability Act in the name of the queen.
Evidence 28
Name: Dhurke's Badge
Description: The symbol of Dhurke's creed: "A dragon never yields." Nahyuta never confiscated it.
Evidence 29
Name: Dhurke's Corpse Photo
Description: More than three days have passed since his death death. He was shot three times in the chest.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: I was feeling under the weather yesterday, and decided to rest these weary bones.
Person: Nayna
Testimony 1
Testimony: Besides which, a lowly servant such as I could not possibly be an honorable spirit medium.
Person: Nayna
Testimony 2
Testimony: Only members of the royal family can learn the art of spirit channeling here in Khura'in.
Person: Nayna
Testimony 3
Testimony: After Queen Amara's passing, Her Eminence, Queen Ga'ran is the only spirit medium left.
Person: Nayna
Testimony 4
Testimony: If you believe a medium to be the culprit, it would have to be that young lass Maya Fey.
Person: Nayna

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else. Let's think step by step:
response:
To find a contradiction between the provided evidence and testimonies, let's analyze the key pieces of information:

1. **Testimony 3 (From Nayna):** Nayna claims that after Queen Amara's passing, Queen Ga'ran is the only spirit medium left.

2. **Evidence 18 (Gemstone):** There is no direct information about spirit medium status in this piece.

3. **Evidence 19 (Pink Butterfly Pendant):** It mentions Amara, highlighting that a locket found at the crime scene belongs to Amara. It indicates that Amara was alive after the incident that Nayna claims she passed away in. 

4. **Evidence 23 (Woman's Photo):** This photo shows Dhurke and Amara, with a clear date indication that is much later than Ga’ran's claim after Amara’s "assassination." This means Amara is likely still alive and not dead earlier as might have been claimed.

Given this, the contradiction lies between Nayna's claim that Queen Amara is no longer alive and the evidence indicating Amara’s continued existence. 

Thus, the correct pair is:

Testimony 3 claims Amara has passed, and Evidence 23 shows the photo of Amara, indicating she was alive, contradicting the claim of her passing.

{"evidence": 23, "testimony": 3}

Person: Amara
Testimony 3

Person: Amara
Testimony 4
Testimony: My husband Dhurke is the killer, but he has fled from this sacred hall.
Person: Amara
Testimony 5

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else. Let's think step by step:
response:
To solve this problem, we need to find a contradiction between an evidence item and a testimony given by Amara. 

Let's start with Amara's testimonies:
1. Amara claims she was not anywhere near the tomb following the murder (Testimony 1).
2. Amara's testimony suggests there was no other spirit to channel until Inga was dead (Testimony 3).

Now, let's compare these testimonies with the evidence provided:

- Testimony 1 suggests Amara wasn't near the tomb, but this doesn't directly contradict any specific evidence.
- Testimony 3 mentions Minister Inga as the sole victim, implying no other spirits were channeled until after his death.

Now, let's investigate the evidence related to channeling or spirits:

- Evidence 19, the Pink Butterfly Pendant, is significant because it's stained with the victim’s blood and actually belongs to Amara. This suggests Amara might have been in the tomb or involved in the events surrounding Inga's death.

Considering this context, if Amara’s pendant was found with the victim's blood, it indicates that she had some involvement with the murder or the scene and contradicts her claim that Inga was the sole victim and no other spirit could have been channeled until after his death. 

Amara's claim in Testimony 3 that "Minister Inga was the sole victim. There was no other spirit to channel until he was dead" might be contradicted by the presence of her own pendant, which is stained with the victim’s blood, indicating her involvement or presence, contrary to her claims.

Therefore, the contradiction pairs Amara's Testimony 3 with Evidence 19, the Pink Butterfly Pendant.

{"evidence": 19, "testimony": 3}

Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: My beloved attorney's badge. Wearing it gets me raring to go.
Evidence 1
Name: Founder's Orb
Description: A national treasure of the Kingdom of Khura'in. None but those of in the royal family have laid eyes on it. Heating the Founder's Orb revealed the statue within. The founder's form has appeared from within. It seems only the queen knows the founder's real name.
Evidence 2
Name: Photo of My Father
Description: A picture of my biological father, Jove Justice, who died in Khura'in.
Evidence 3
Name: Study Photo
Description: Atishon saw Datz fleeing the scene the night of the murder. One of the books is stained with coffee.
Evidence 4
Name: Study Diagram
Description: A diagram of the doctors's study. Note the bookcase, large window, and second-floor area.
Evidence 5
Name: Research Notes
Description: Research notes on the Song of Ceremony and the box containing the Founder's Orb.
Evidence 6
Name: Orb Transfer Agreement
Description: States: "I agree to hand over the Founder's Orb to the Defiant Dragons if I will come to no harm."
Evidence 7
Name: Sarge's Drone
Description: A helicopter drone operated by the doctor's kid. Equipped with a camera and a microphone.
Evidence 8
Name: Glowing Moss
Description: Stuck to the insole of the doctor's boot. It probably got there when he went to hide the Founder's Orb.
Evidence 9
Name: E-Mail
Description: Data obtained from the doctor's computer. Includes a report on his research into the Founder's Orb.
Evidence 10
Name: Doctor's Reading Glasses
Description: The doctor's poor eyesight meant he couldn't read anything without these. They were found on his desk.
Evidence 11
Name: Raincoat
Description: Seems the doctor wore this last night. Bears a distinctive yellow and green two-tone design.
Evidence 12
Name: Robbery Report
Description: A report filed a year ago by one Mr. Paul Atishon-Wimperson for the theft of the Crystal of Ami Fey.
Evidence 13
Name: Dr. Buff's Autopsy Report
Description: Dr. Buff was struck with the corner of some object. The time of death is between 10 and 11 PM.
Evidence 14
Name: Armie's Statement
Description: She'd fled to her room when she realized someone had moved her while she'd been unconscious on the second floor.
Evidence 15
Name: Inga's Autopsy Report
Description: Stabbed from behind. Cause of death is blood loss. Time of death is approximately 3 PM.
Evidence 16
Name: Tomb Diagram
Description: A diagram of the crime scene. Amara's sarcophagus is in the very center of the room.
Evidence 17
Name: Tomb Crime Photo
Description: A photo of Inga's body. He was stabbed in the back with a knife.
Evidence 18
Name: Gemstone
Description: Inga's button, discovered in the ashes of the tomb's incense burners. Caked in soot.
Evidence 19
Name: Pink Butterfly Pendant
Description: A pendant adorned with a pink butterfly. Seems it belongs to Dhurke. Stained with the victim's blood. A locket found at the crime scene. It actually belongs to Amara.
Evidence 20
Name: Mysterious Bloodstain
Description: A bloodstain from Amara's Tomb. This bloodstain found had been wiped up by someone. Analysis reveals that it's Dhurke's blood.
Evidence 21
Name: Painkiller Shots
Description: The medication Inga used for his back pain. Said to make the pain disappear.
Evidence 22
Name: Inga's Notepad
Description: A notepad used by Inga. People's characteristics are written inside.
Evidence 23
Name: Woman's Photo
Description: A photo showing Dhurke and Amara's life on the run about 23 years ago. [caption] Amara is holding a baby, sitting on a chair. Behind her are some books. One of the books has the logo of the Defiant Dragons on its cover.
Evidence 24
Name: Channeling Photo
Description: A picture taken at around 2 PM of the channeling rite.
Evidence 25

Description: At around 2 PM, Shah'do was surprised by a firecracker, ran into the courtyard, spooked Nayna and stole her hat.

Description: A file containing a ton of info on the assassination of Amara Sigatar Khura'in.

Evidence 28
Name: Dhurke's Badge

Evidence 29
Name: Dhurke's Corpse Photo
Description: More than three days have passed since his death death. He was shot three times in the chest.

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else. Let's think step by step:
response:
To determine which evidence and testimony contradict each other, let's first analyze the available information:

1. **Evidence Analysis**:
    - Evidence 26, "Amara's Assassination File": This file contains information about an assassination attempt on Amara Sigatar Khura'in.
    - It is likely relevant to any claims about past attempts on Amara's life.

2. **Testimony Analysis**:
    - Testimony 3 by Nahyuta states: "I consider it divine judgment cast upon a fiend who sought to assassinate our monarch."
    - Nahyuta is implying that Minister Inga was involved in an assassination plot against the monarch.

3. **Contradiction Identification**:
    - Evidence 26 contains detailed information about the assassination of Amara Sigatar Khura'in, the previous queen and a spirit medium.
    - If the Testimony 3 refers to Minister Inga as trying to assassinate the monarch who is Queen Amara, there should be evidence supporting this specific claim in the assassination file.
    - The absence of such details in the file about Inga being linked to the assassination of Queen Amara would create a contradiction.

After reviewing the evidence and testimonies, the contradiction is found between the lack of specific claims about Minister Inga in the assassination file (Evidence 26) and Nahyuta's testimony (Testimony 3) suggesting divine judgment on a fiend who sought to assassinate the monarch.

{"evidence": 26, "testimony": 3}
